question: Which country released its new anti-monopoly guidelines targeting internet platforms?
explanation:
The market regulator of China released new anti-monopoly guidelines targeting internet platforms. The rules seek to tighten the restrictions faced by the tech giants of the country.
The country released the anti-monopoly draft law in November last year. The guidelines will impact e-commerce sites such as Alibaba Group’s Taobao, Tmall marketplaces, JD.com and payment services like Ant Group’s Alipay and WeChat Pay.
